feedback.Physical object: Included — A dust particle is a tangible, bounded material entity that occupies space.
feedback.Man-made / synthetic: Excluded — Dust particles can be natural or artificial; synthetic origin is not intrinsic.
feedback.Biological or biologically-inspired: Excluded — Most dust is inorganic; even biological dust (e.g. dander) isn't inherently biological in identity.
feedback.Fixed/static: Excluded — Dust is typically mobile and easily disturbed.
feedback.Structural: Excluded — A dust particle has no load-bearing or designed structural role.
feedback.Perceptible: Excluded — An individual dust particle is usually below visual threshold without amplification.
feedback.Material form: Included — It consists of solid matter and occupies a specific form in space.
feedback.Passive: Included — It has no agency and only responds to external forces (e.g., wind, electrostatics).
feedback.Purposeful / intentional: Excluded — It is not designed or purposed by default.
feedback.Emits output / produces effect: Excluded — It doesn’t generate outputs unless in context (e.g., pollutant); not intrinsic.
feedback.Processes or regulates logic/signals: Excluded — It has no signaling or processing capability.
feedback.Transforms or modifies internal state: Excluded — No autonomous or inherent transformation occurs.
feedback.Interacts with humans directly: Excluded — Any interaction is incidental, not intrinsic to identity.
feedback.Part of a larger system: Excluded — May aggregate but not inherently systemic.
feedback.Autonomous in function: Excluded — No autonomy or function independent of environment.
feedback.System-critical: Excluded — Not essential to any defined system by nature.
feedback.Symbolic / representational: Excluded — Not used symbolically without imposed interpretation.
feedback.Communicative: Excluded — Does not inherently transmit or encode information.
feedback.Logical / rule-based: Excluded — Has no logic or structure governed by internal rules.
feedback.Hierarchical / modular: Excluded — Not composed of subsystems or organizational levels.
feedback.Behavior-guiding: Excluded — Does not guide or constrain actions.
feedback.Self-referential / meta-conceptual: Excluded — Not capable of referencing or representing itself.
feedback.Temporal: Excluded — Exists in time, but temporality is not abstracted into its identity.
feedback.Contextual abstraction: Excluded — It is a direct physical entity, not a conceptual construct.
feedback.Socially / culturally constructed: Excluded — Its identity does not derive from social convention.
feedback.Defined by a group/system: Excluded — Not framed by institutions or classifications by default.
feedback.Linked to identity or role: Excluded — Not tied to roles, identities, or functions.
feedback.Regulated / governed: Excluded — No rules govern its behavior by design.
feedback.Teachable / transmissible: Excluded — Not a unit of knowledge or transferrable concept.
feedback.Visible: Excluded — Not typically visible as an individual entity without tools.
feedback.Context-sensitive: Excluded — Exists independently of specific contextual frames.
feedback.Widely known: Excluded — Dust as a category is known, but an individual particle is not culturally salient.

encoding_notes: This encoding describes a generic, isolated dust particle, not a symbolic aggregate like 'dust' in literature or 'pollution' in policy. Perceptibility and social traits are excluded due to scale and lack of cultural framing. Passive is now correctly included, as a dust particle exhibits no agency or internal behavior.
